title: Simplify the way you seed Tables!
post: In your package.json file, under scripts add in 'seed': 'node seeds/{filename}' You can also use 'npm run seeds'!

title: Sequelize Data Types
post: You can use data types such as INTEGER, VARCHAR(#), TEXT, and STRING to define Sequelize models

title: Object-Relational Mapping
post: I have really loved learning about ORMs. It really simplified the way I create queries in SQL!

title: Path
post: By requiring path into your main code, you can set a default folder that your application will use for all of its components

title: Hashing
post: For security hashing is used when creating a password, which converts the given string to an encrypted string, which can be converted back within the program for verification

title: Express
post: Using Express.js, you can create a server in javascript.
